item.title: Damaged backboard, faded lines, 10th November
item.description:
Backboard is completely stripped of any sports-related marking. Previously existing lines are now worn away completely, eg 3-point line. Also, the double rim, ie a smaller diameter rim slightly below the original makes it more difficult to use since the ball bounces back out when it shouldn't. Ideally there'd be a net or chain.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnwood Road, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding of footpath and track in Prestbury Prak, 10th November
item.description:
After rain, the footpath from the car park and onto the circular path both flood (see photo) making them unusable. The surrounding grass is likely to turn to mud during the winter months as the many park users are forced to walk around the flood when the ground is wet.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Barn Close, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pot hole in middle of brookfield road at junction with albermarle road, 10th November
item.description:
Brookfield road, at junction of albermarle road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albemarle Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely loud drain noise inside house, 10th November
item.description:
Outside 52 Cheltenham Road East on the new section of road that was installed after they omitted the drainage on 21/10/25 Loose drain that rattles when a car drives over it. It’s a busy main road. This is affecting my quality of life and is a human right not to have loud noises continually daily from outside on a brand new drain. If this was from a house the council would deal with it. I have a recording from inside my house and it’s unbearable. I shouldn’t have to put up with this for what is prob a quick fix. I am happy to pay for any repairs if it gets it done. I can’t cope much longer

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding on street and drive, 10th November
item.description:
After rain this area is always flooded. I don't think there is a drain in the road - it's poor levels and no run-off which causes the flood. This has been reported to the council several times over the last 5 years by different people.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellesley Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
